title: Resistances of different power devices in parallel

content.question: An electric heater and a lamp are connected in parallel across a <math alttext="120 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>120</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> circuit. The heater operates at <math alttext="1000 watts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and the lamp operates at <math alttext="100 watts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The ratio of the resistance of the heater to the resistance of the lamp is

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
